title: Tracking issue for panics in mem::uninitialized/zeroed

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: Category: A tracking issue for an RFC or an unstable feature.

body:
With https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/66059, `mem::uninitialized` and `mem::zeroed` dynamically detect some misuses (such as `mem::zeroed::<&T>()` or `mem::uninitialized::<bool>()`) and panic instead of causing UB. Also see [this summary for the original FCP](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/66059#issuecomment-586734747). But the check is conservative for now to reduce breakage. This is to track strengthening the check.

* [x] We should recursively check the fields of structs and tuples. This is happening in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/71274.
* [ ] We should check inside arrays, too. We currently do not because smallvec < 0.6.13 didn't use `MaybeUninit` and thus triggers this check (if the type inside the array has invalid bit patterns). Other widely-used crates that trigger the panic as of [Dec 2021](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/87041#issuecomment-997587451):
    * hyper ([fixed](https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/pull/2545) since 0.14.12)
    * crossbeam-queue 0.2.1, crossbeam-channel 0.3.9, crossbeam 0.2.12 (these are ancient; current versions are fine AFAIK)
* [ ] We should check `Variant::Multiple` enums, which currently we do not just to stay conservative.
